title: 15 Best Hot Sandwich Melts
description: From classic tuna melts to veggie-stacked versions, these open-faced melt sandwiches make simple and satisfying meals.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Our 15 Best Melts Will Make Your Mouth Water By Mary Claire Lagroue Mary Claire Lagroue Mary Claire Lagroue is the Commerce Editor at Food & Wine. A former associate editor at Allrecipes, she joined Dotdash Meredith in 2019. She has written about food since 2017, covering everything from product reviews to recipes to restaurants. Her work can be found in Cooking Light, Southern Living, and more.  Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on July 14, 2020 Close Credits: Deborah Pinn Broiled or baked in the oven, melts rank among our favorite sandwiches. The toasty bread! The hearty toppings! The cheese in all its gooey glory! Okay, we'll stop there. Our top 15 melt recipes speak for themselves. 01 of 15 Cheesy Tuna Melts View Recipe Save KGora "These were surprisingly good and so easy! I made sure to chop up my celery very fine so my little ones didn't fuss," Nichole says. "I think I may play around with the type of cheese in the future. Not that there was anything wrong with the Cheddar, but I think provolone or even pepperjack may be a nice change here and there. What a fantastic busy weeknight fix!" 02 of 15 Chicken Fajita Melts View Recipe Save "These cheesy chicken sandwich melts have all of the flavor of fajitas without the drippy mess!" —laughingmagpie 03 of 15 Chef John's Monte Cristo Benedict View Recipe Save Baking Nana "If you are reading reviews to decide whether or not to make this, just make it already. I make this all the time. This is a fantastic breakfast. I have substituted the Cheddar for smoked Gouda at times which I really enjoy," Ben Nesbitt says. 04 of 15 Classic Patty Melt View Recipe Save Classic Patty Melt. Yoly You can't call it a classic unless it deserves that honor, and this patty melt certainly does. Warm beef, tender onions, salty cheese — it's simple, it's basic, it's classic. 05 of 15 Mini Reubens View Recipe Save Kraig "I love the classic Reuben sandwich, but these appetizers are even better! Since they have less bread, you can taste the other flavors better. And they are healthier since they are broiled rather than grilled with lots of butter." — Mama Cass 06 of 15 Vegetarian Open Faced Sandwich View Recipe Save pomplemousse This flavorful veggie melt layers sliced tomatoes, onions, eggplant, bell pepper, and mushrooms between pesto and cheese. 07 of 15 Best Tuna Melt (New Jersey Diner Style) View Recipe Save Alana "My husband said this is the best tuna melt he has EVER had. And I don't know anyone who likes tuna melts as much as him, so I was impressed!" — Amanda1982 08 of 15 California Melt View Recipe Save Deborah Pinn "So delicious! I made this for lunch today and was so anxious to eat it that I forgot the mushrooms. Next time I'll add them, and I'm sure it will be even better. I loved the crunch from the almonds," Julie Fegler says. 09 of 15 Olive Cheese Melts View Recipe Save "Sensational," Laurie says. "Like some other folks, I used green olives instead of black. I think I would leave the salt out completely when using green olives. This was delish!" 10 of 15 The Munroe Melt View Recipe Save Baking Nana "Now this is a sandwich," Jillian says. "This is perfect for a quick weeknight meal when you don't have time to cook or just don't feel like it." 11 of 15 Tuna Panini Melt View Recipe Save bd.weld Between sourdough bread and balsamic vinegar in the tuna salad, this creamy Tuna Panini Melt delivers a subtle tang. 12 of 15 The Hot Brown View Recipe Save "Not your average hot turkey sandwich, the Hot Brown was invented at the Brown Hotel in Louisville, Kentucky to absorb the bourbon that guests would enjoy well into the night," writes recipe creator Chef John. A variation on the traditional Welsh rarebit, the Hot Brown often uses ham, tomatoes, and pimentos under a topping of browned cheese. 13 of 15 Classic Cuban Midnight (Medianoche) Sandwich View Recipe Save lutzflcat "This is one of the more famous sandwiches straight out of the island of Cuba," writes recipe creator Pretty Pink Bullets. "This recipe came from my uncle who used to work at a restaurant in Pinar del Rio, Cuba and now works at a Cuban cafeteria here in Miami. This sandwich is best served with fried plantain chips and a cold mamey milkshake!" 14 of 15 Sriracha Quinoa Burger Melt View Recipe Save VancouverBicks Meat-free and melty, this black bean-and-quinoa burger gets a kick of spice and heat from sriracha. But the ooey-gooey topping of Emmentaler cheese balance it nicely. 15 of 15 Shrimp Melt View Recipe Save jimsellingson This melt recipe originally calls for English muffins, but slices of bread will work beautifully. Old Bay adds tongue-tingling flavor, while provolone helps blunt the spicy edge. Explore more: Recipes Main Dishes Sandwich Recipes Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
